net.aws.conn

Class AwsConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.aws.conn.AwsConnection

  • public class AwsConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    The AwsConnectionTemplate class will take care of connecting to the database using pooled connection and executing a SQL statement via Prepared Statement to avoid SQL Injection. It is created as an abstract class that can be extended for different SQL queries. It is important to set the PreparedStatement variable when extending the abstract method setPreparedStatement
    Author:
    Sebastian Luca

    • Constructor Detail

      • AwsConnection

        public AwsConnection()
        This constructor needs to be called from the child classes after calling the setPreparedStatement method, otherwise the system will crash. This constructor will firstly create a connection using the credentials that were set above, after which it will execute the prepared statement

    • Method Detail

      • connectToOracle

        private void connectToOracle()
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - This method connects to the Oracle Database using the static final credentials set in the class. This way it will generate the connection object needed to query the database

      • setPreparedStatement

        private void setPreparedStatement(java.lang.String query)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Parameters:
        query - A string containing the SQL Query that needs to be executed
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if provided query string was not built correctly This method creates the prepare statement using the received query

      • incrementHitCount

        public int incrementHitCount(int loc_id)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.sql.SQLException
        This method is used to increase the times an accident has been recorded at the same coordinates. It accesses a SQL UPDATE query which increments by one the current hitCount for specified id.
        Parameters:
        loc_id - is an integer representing the id of the location that needs incrementing
        Returns:
        1 if update was a success and 0 otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when accessing query properties file
        java.sql.SQLException - when executing operations using Prepared Statement object

      • getHitCount

        public int getHitCount(java.lang.String latitude,
                       java.lang.String longitude)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.sql.SQLException
        This method queries the database for entries that are 100 meters from specified position. If an entry is found, the ID is returned. If not, -1 is returned
        Parameters:
        latitude - represents first Coordinate of current position
        longitude - represents second Coordinate of current position
        Returns:
        and integer representing the ID of the found entry. If no entry is found, -1 is returned
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when accessing query properties file
        java.sql.SQLException - when executing operations using Prepared Statement object

      • insertCoordinates

        public int insertCoordinates(java.lang.String latitude,
                             java.lang.String longitude)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.sql.SQLException
        Takes the latitude and longitude as parameters and inserts them into the Database. It takes the query from the query properties file, adds the coordinates as Strings in the prepared statement object and executes the statement.
        Parameters:
        latitude - the first GPS coordinate
        longitude - the second GPS coordinate
        Returns:
        the result as a ResultSet. It needs to be then parsed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the query property file is not found
        java.sql.SQLException - in case the builded query has errors

      • usernameExists

        public boolean usernameExists(java.lang.String username)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.sql.SQLException
        Method checks if requested username exists in the database. If that is true, the first row will be found and next() method will return true
        Parameters:
        username -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • insertUser

        public int insertUser(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String surname,
                      java.lang.String username,
                      java.lang.String email,
                      java.lang.String password,
                      java.lang.String salt,
                      java.lang.String permissions,
                      java.sql.Date birthdate,
                      int securityQuestionID)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.sql.SQLException
        This method adds a new user to the database by running the query saved in the properties file. The return is an int that shows the affected number of rows
        Parameters:
        name - the user's name
        surname - the user's surname
        username - the new username
        email - the user's Email address
        password - the 256 bit hashed password
        salt - the 256 bit generated security key
        permissions - the user permission ('adm' for admin / 'usr' for user)
        birthdate - the date of birth as a String
        securityQuestionID - the ID for the selected security question taken from the security questions table in the database
        Returns:
        1 if row was inserted or 0 if insert had an error. See PreparedStatement.executeUpdate()
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if method could not read from Query properties file
        java.sql.SQLException - if the run query did not complete.

        public void closeConn()
